DOC.brief_summary: Title : CLOSE-guided pulmonary vein isolation ( PVI ) Cure Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation ( 'CLOSE CURE ' study ) Design : This prospective , observational , single-center , unblinded , clinical 3-year study . Background : In population paroxysmal atrial fibrillation ( AF ) 'CLOSE'-guided PVI , new approach obtain single-procedure durable PVI , show virtually eliminate recurrence AF 1 year follow-up repetitive discontinuous Holter monitoring . Objectives : ( 1 ) To objectively compare atrial tachyarrhythmia ( ATA ) burden 'CLOSE'-guided base PVI use continuous monitoring . ( 2 ) To assess ATA burden use continuous monitor 3 year ablation . ( 3 ) To identify baseline structural electrical property atria procedural characteristic predict 1-year 3-year outcome . Enrollment : Up 100 subject enrol observational , prospective study . Clinical Sites : 1 site . Subject Population : Eligible patient patient paroxysmal high-burden AF plan 'CLOSE'-guided PV isolation . At time procedural plan ask patient his/her consent ( 1 ) implantation subcutaneous continuous loop recorder ( sCLR ) , ( 2 ) concise electrophysiological study time PVI , ( 3 ) transthoracic echocardiogram time PVI ( 4 ) collection data 3 year . Anti-arrhythmic drug treatment ( ADT ) oral anticoagulation ( OAC ) give accord updated 2012 European society Cardiology ( ESC ) guideline AF ( Camm et al , European Heart Journal 2012 ) 2012 Heart rhythm society ( HRS ) /European Heart Rhythm association/European cardiac arrhythmic society Expert Consensus Statement catheter surgical ablation atrial fibrillation ( Calkins et al , Heart Rhythm 2012 ) .
